A lot of balloons do not have a "propulsion system" they simply drift with the wind.  If you want your balloon to drift in a particular direction, you pump gas in or out of the envelope to move the balloon up or down to where the wind is blowing in the direction you want it to go. Balloons with a "propulsion system" are usually called "Dirigibles". For example the Goodyear Blimp.

"Did not appear to be self-maneuvering" ... what? If it was a balloon, it would be drifting downwind aimlessly at the same speed and direction as the prevailing winds. If was moving in any direction other than the prevailing winds or moving at a speed in excess of the prevailing winds, it would certainly be considered self-maneuvering or maneuvering under remote control unless tethered to some other moving object. Few if any weather balloons have solar panels and its unlikely a weather balloon with solar panels as large as balloon 1  had is a weather balloon.  Based on panel size and considering  charging power reserves, the panels were powering several hundred watts of equipment which would be highly unusual unless it was capturing massive amounts of data in the form of photos and more importantly low energy radio signals.   Radio signals from microcontrollers, closed networks, and point-to-point networks can not be easily captured by satellites but would be key to understanding and attacking infrastructure.   It is also likely that the balloon was interrogating and attacking the encryption of low power data stations and APs.   These closed, low power, and poiint-to-point radios are the second oe third greatest threat to US infrastructure, and many are protected by weak encryption and obsurity.   It is also likely that control of said balloon and data collection were shared duties of remote and local (Chicoms on the ground) operators and data collectors.   Even if this balloon was fake, the infrastructure weakness exists, and balloons are unique attack vectors that should mot be dismissed.   Profiling, war driving, and pentesting data systems and radio communications  via high altitude balloons is a very interesting idea and again, would produce data and results, not otherwise available on such a large scale.

It is pretty obvious they are just high-altitude balloons.  There are LOTS of them over the sky.  Many of them are flying around 60K above ground and flow around the world for couple years before crashing into oceans or barren land.  They have limited onboard power to nudge the balloons to a general direction but can not really control much other than control how they get crashed.    Almost all of these high-altitude balloons are equipped with solar panels.  Some have solar panels placed horizontally like the one from China.  And others might have the solar panels placed vertically.  So they look like cylindrical objects.  And some are complicated enough that they have multiple faces and layers.  So they look like eight sided objects.  What US military doing is actually violating the international norm about high-altitude balloons.  US itself, for example, under Project Genetrix, flew more than 500 high-altitude balloons into China and Russia territories and other nations.  And China and Russia are doing the same.  The national air space is around 30K feet above ground.  And international laws are vague about flying objects at 60K above.  Unfortunately, US military, politicians and media are sucked into this tragic fanfare of irrational thinking and reporting.  And the American public is being jerked around, like bobbling heads.  I really hope we can think with reason and realize what is going on.  And stop acting "surprised" or "outrage".  It is normal for nations to fly high-altitude balloons.  They might be spy balloons or weather balloons.  Just like low orbit satellites.  It is fine as long as everyone follows the same rules.  And unfortunately US is breaking it under its own national frenzy.  And now it is much more difficult for nations to fly high-altitude balloons which is actually a very good way for scientific research.  And yes some balloons are used for spying.  Get over it.

First is that this could easily be a COUNTER-intel program which parallels actual SIGINT (Signals Intelligence) collection programs.  We know there are SIGINT programs going on we just verified the one off the East Coast.  We should ALSO expect a counter-intel program as a cover for these known spy collection assets. If 'they' (enemy) want better odds at slipping their large and expensive collection assets past our defenses one way is to fill our airspace with many many balloon type objects. Design them to be seen (Mylar reflectors and geometric design to reflect radar on purpose and lower altitude).  Then while US defenses are busy with these distractions the REAL high altitude SIGNIT collection assets go about their mission unmolested. This is an ignorant question because these airborne assets from country 'X ' were likely deployed weeks or months ago depending on altitude. This is a non sequitur full stop until we can verify these were under guidance AND propulsion (which has not been verified).  We need more data to conclude anything beyond this full stop.

There are several potential advances in the realm of military applications for ion propulsion drones, including:  Long-Duration Surveillance: Ion propulsion drones can be designed for long-duration missions, making them ideal for surveillance and reconnaissance missions that require persistence over a large area. Orbital Capabilities: Ion propulsion drones can be used to perform missions in low-Earth orbit, such as satellite servicing, inspection, and repair. High-Altitude Flight: Ion propulsion drones can reach high altitudes, making them ideal for atmospheric research, weather monitoring, and other scientific missions. Stealth Capabilities: Ion propulsion drones can be designed with low acoustic and thermal signatures, making them harder to detect and track. This makes them useful for stealthy reconnaissance missions or as part of a stealthy strike package. Increased Payload Capacity: Ion propulsion drones can be designed with a high payload capacity, making them ideal for carrying sensors, weapons, or other payloads.

At this point I think it's safe to say we have no idea if these more recent objects are even terrestrial in origin.  What the pilots are describing are the same things that pilots from the F/A 18 USS Nimitz strike force described after the Pentagon released the 2004 video taken from the Surper Hornets' POD displays.  They said they could not identify a means of propulsion or heat signature.  They looked like tic tacs the size of a car... and sometimes they would just hover over the ocean and move out of the way when a jet would fly through... and like seagulls, they'd move out of the way and then return to their previous formation... but other times the crafts would fly from 60,000 ft to sea level in less than a second.  They were able to lock on with their POD system, but they weren't given permission to engage.  It's sounds like these are the exact same crafts, but with them at commercials aircraft altitude, they presented a safety hazard.... but I think they were mainly pushed to engage because of the China balloon incident a week earlier off the eastern seaboard.  Meaning they were at high alert for enemy aircraft.   But I think its beginning to sound as though these last 3 vehicles had nothing to do with the China balloons, and weren't balloons at all.  In fact, a report just came out by Russia saying they shot one of these objects down last month... and China just 5 hours ago said it engaged and attempted to shoot one down.  These are NOT balloons.  They may be some highly technical drones from a private company or even foreign adversary... but with the previous declassified videos from the Pentagon 3 years ago, combined with the pilot descriptions, we have to consider these might also be something of non-terrestrial origin.

For centuries, people have reported sightings of strange flying objects in the sky. One of the earliest recorded instances occurred in 1878, when a farmer in the United States claimed to have seen a large, dark, circular object resembling a balloon moving at incredible speed. This led to a wave of similar reports of "mystery airships" in various parts of the country over the next two decades, causing some people to fear that renowned inventor Thomas Edison had created an artificial flying star. More recently, reports of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) in the USA and Canada have been linked to the proliferation of Chinese balloons. This highlights the ongoing human tendency to misinterpret and speculate about aerial phenomena, as well as the persistence of UFO sightings and beliefs.

During WW2 the Japanese launched thousands of balloons into the Jetstream. These balloons carried anti-personnel bombs and incendiary bombs. The Japanese scientist had been able to calculate time and distance and equipped the balloons with  altimeter controls to ensure they would fall on Americas west coast. Literally hundreds made it to Canada the US and Mexico. The plan was to set the forests on fire and cause chaos for America. The bombs did cause casualties, some years after the war ended, after they were discovered and set off by people curious of discovering what they had found. At first they were thought harmless weather balloons.

ğŸ˜† the depths to which these intelligence expert "guests" go to in order implicate the U.S.'s two chief adversaries, namely, China and Russia; now there is this wide-eyed wild theory about a brewing "military coup" in China being possibly behind the so-called "spy balloon."  In the meantime...  One U.S. official said that _"without transparency, people will find ways to fill in the gaps."_  Well, there are certainly big gaps, if not big potholes, in the official narratives around "foreign flying objects" that have made the headlines lately.   Number one gap, in the latest "flying object" sightings: the government said that it is *_neither a balloon nor an aircraft._*  Someone somewhere is bound to think it's an extraterrestrial phenomenon.  Number two gap on the latest sightings: they are allegedly *_unguided_* and *_unmanned_* aerial objects with no visible *_intelligence_* capability or *_weaponry._*  And then, we are told that it "made sense" to shoot down the latest foreign "flying objects" _before_ they drifted _deeper_ into the U.S. airspace. This comes after criticism of the Biden administration's handling of the so-called "spy balloon."  The latest foreign flying objects are comparatively "much smaller" than the gigantic "spy balloons," yet they are said to be a much "bigger threat," supposedly due to their "lower" flying altitudes. Conversely, it's anyone's guess what could've been onboard the _high-flying_ "spy balloon"; the contents of the payload could have been "dangerous" at any given point.  The latest flying object was shot down over icey waters, which was cited as one of the reasons for not shooting down the "spy balloon."  The latest foreign flying objects did "not appear to be drifting with precision," but we are told that a "spy balloon" had "clear precision guidance." Nothing is provided on what supposedly gave the balloon its precision-guided drift; was it a fuel-powered mechanical propulsion system, like, say, a turbo engine (jet or propelled)? If the balloon on had one, then it was certainly not visible on the video & photographic captures of the aerial device.  We are told that retrieved "antennas" are "proof" of the balloon's "spying" mission. Antennas are used for receiving and sending broadcast signals. It doesn't have to be a spy device to have antennas.  The U.S. military had no qualms about shooting down a foreign flying object over Canadian territory. Could the debris thereof not have fallen on people on the ground? ...a few gaps among a number of others that could use some "filling up." ğŸ™‚

There's something that bothers me. When the US shot down that massive spy balloon, the Chinese were pretty outraged, they claimed it was a civilian airship, and that shooting it down represented an example of excessive use of force, or something to that effect. But now, the Chinese haven't said anything. If the objects shot down over Alaska, Canada and the Great Lakes were just Chinese balloons, you would expect some form of reaction from Beijing. The White House and the Pentagon have also been suspiciously silent about the nature of these objects.   We know, thanks to the Canadian Defense Minister, that one of these objects was a cylinder, not a balloon. Now, I'm not claiming (without evidence) that these aircraft have an extraterrestrial origin, but if this were the case, I believe the public has the right to know, especially if we consider that over the last few years, the government itself has declassified footage of so-called Unexplained Aerial Phenomena (UAPs), which seem to match the description of some of these objects, at least when it comes to not having visible means of propulsion.   Bottom line: if it's the Chinese, demand that they stop sending aircraft over US airspace. But if these three objects didn't come from China, or from anywhere else on this Earth, organize a big press conference and just tell the whole truth. I believe that people are smart enough to handle the truth, no matter how strange it may be.

John F. Kennedy on Secrecy:  "The very word "secrecy" is repugnant in a free and open society; and we are as a people inherently and historically opposed to secret societies, to secret oaths and secret proceedings.  We decided long ago that the dangers of excessive and unwarranted concealment of pertinent facts far outweighed the dangers which are cited to justify it. Even today, there is little value in opposing the threat of a closed society by imitating its arbitrary restrictions.  Even today, there is little value in insuring the survival of our nation if our traditions do not survive with it. And there is very grave danger that an announced need for increased security will be seized upon those anxious to expand its meaning to the very limits of official censorship and concealment.  That I do not intend to permit to the extent that it is in my control.  And no official of my Administration, whether his rank is high or low, civilian or military, should interpret my words here tonight as an excuse to censor the news, to stifle dissent, to cover up our mistakes or to withhold from the press and the public the facts they deserve to know."  For we are opposed around the world by a monolithic and ruthless conspiracy that relies on covert means for expanding its sphere of influence--on infiltration instead of invasion, on subversion instead of elections, on intimidation instead of free choice, on guerrillas by night instead of armies by day.  It is a system which has conscripted vast human and material resources into the building of a tightly knit, highly efficient machine that combines military, diplomatic, intelligence, economic, scientific and political operations.  Its preparations are concealed, not published. Its mistakes are buried not headlined. Its dissenters are silenced, not praised. No expenditure is questioned, no rumor is printed, no secret is revealed."  "No President should fear public scrutiny of his program. For from that scrutiny comes understanding; and from that understanding comes support or opposition. And both are necessary.  I am not asking your newspapers to support the Administration, but I am asking your help in the tremendous task of informing and alerting the American people. For I have complete confidence in the response and dedication of our citizens whenever they are fully informed.  I not only could not stifle controversy among your readers-- I welcome it.  This Administration intends to be candid about its errors; for as a wise man once said: "An error does not become a mistake until you refuse to correct it." We intend to accept full responsibility for our errors; and we expect you to point them out when we miss them.  Without debate, without criticism, no Administration and no country can succeed-- and no republic can survive.  That is why the Athenian lawmaker Solon decreed it a crime for any citizen to shrink from controversy.  And that is why our press was protected by the First (emphasized) Amendment-- the only business in America specifically protected by the Constitution-- not primarily to amuse and entertain, not to emphasize the trivial and sentimental, not to simply "give the public what it wants"--but to inform, to arouse, to reflect, to state our dangers and our opportunities, to indicate our crises and our choices, to lead, mold educate and sometimes even anger public opinion.  This means greater coverage and analysis of international news-- for it is no longer far away and foreign but close at hand and local. It means greater attention to improved understanding of the news as well as improved transmission. And it means, finally, that government at all levels, must meet its obligation to provide you with the fullest possible information outside the narrowest limits of national security...  And so it is to the printing press--to the recorder of mans deeds, the keeper of his conscience, the courier of his news-- that we look for strength and assistance, confident that with your help man will be what he was born to be: free and independent."

_No obvious means of propulsion._      *March 16, 1965:* At approximately 6:00 P.M., central standard time I was standing in our yard near the porch in front of our house when I noticed a strange looking craft about a half-mile away approaching from slightly south of east. Aircraft followed a regular route north and south, but virtually never flew east and west. This craft appeared to consist of one or more rectangular metal boxes stacked upon one another in the center with smaller rectangular metal boxes abutting it on each side.  It had no wings. That is the way it looked head-on as it flew towards me.     The only sound that it made was a gentle swishing sound similar to that of grouse gliding through the air. When it got closer, I noticed that this craft appeared to be made of brushed stainless steel with a slightly reddish glint. The sun had not yet set. No lights, no moving parts, no emissions. It was about two and a half times the size of an automobile. The front sloped downwards from the top, two-thirds of the way down to the bottom, with a profile similar to early 1990s Ford minivans. Glass extended from halfway up to within an eighth of the way to the top. At the time this craft did not appear to be saucer shaped, but that might be because I was viewing it head on with the play of light and a slightly rocking motion making it look like rectangular boxes pressed together and piled upon one another due to minor surface variations of rectangular sheets pieced together to form the whole craft. _I retained a distinct impression of its sharp angular design, especially of the seam that separated the side from the front, with no attempt at softening its features, as if it were a prototype._     My mother was at the clothesline about 200 feet away.      Two men dressed in white uniforms were standing inside the craft and were on the side nearest to me about midway between the front and the back in a narrow corridor that seemed to go all the way around the craft behind which was a bulkhead that reached the ceiling so that you could not see all the way through to the other side. Their uniforms were like those worn by American military officers, plain white tunics without any insignia and they were not wearing caps. I was left with the distinct impression of them resembling fine-featured Englishmen. The attention of one man who seemed to be operating controls at a console that was hidden from view beneath the level of the window was directed downwards while the other man looked outside. The craft flew within fifty feet south of me at an altitude of about 400 feet at its closest point. The man looking out the window drew the other manâ€™s attention to my mother who was hanging clothes at the clothesline. The craft came to a virtual stop as they gazed at her when one of the men glanced up and spotting me watching them, reacted like he was startled, alerted the other man and the craft sped off at high speed beyond a grove of trees and was soon out of sight.     _That this happened two days before the first space walk on March 18, 1965 enables me to establish the date._          Latitude: 52 degrees, 7 minutes, 21.1008 seconds North  Longitude: 100 degrees, 45 minutes, 3.96 seconds West

This illustrates something police departments know (if they're honest)...eyewitness accounts are almost never 100% accurate, different people will see different things.  Individual confirmation biases (based on individual experiences), and perspectives from different directions can lead to very different interpretations of the same event.  The classic example is blind men describing an elephant.  This is what makes our current polarization possible.

All those who followed the events since the beginning, minute by minute, know that something very unusual happened. The object that was shot down over Alaska on Friday was described as cylinder-shaped, metallic, the size of a small car, had no visible propulsion system, and it blew up when it crashed on the ground. The one that appeared over Yukon in Canada had the same appearance, according to Canada's defense minister. Some of the F-22 pilots who tracked the object over Canada said it interfered with their sensors. All these descriptions look very similar to the Nimitz UFO incident of 2004. A while later, the FAA closed the airspace in Montana for 'defense activities', and two congressmen confirmed the presence of an object near Havre and that the US military would monitor it overnight, and bring it down in the morning.  A while later, there was a sudden and complete change in narrative. The Yukon object that was said to be cylindrical is now a "metallic balloon carrying a payload", according to officials, and the Montana object was nothing more than a false alarm, according to NORAD. All these explanations are complete BS to cover up the incident and calm the situation down, just like they did with the Roswell crash of 1947. They first stated it was an actual UFO, 48 hours later, it's nothing more than a weather balloon. The object that was seen over Montana was NOT a false alarm. The radar hits were most likely real, but the objects took off at great speed before the fighter jets got there. So in order to avoid public embarrassment and panic, they stated that it was just a false alarm.

And this is why we have UFO sightings: because it's not always easy to identify what you are looking at, especially at those speeds, under stress, or through limited sight, weather etc.  Bottom line is this: Just because you don't know what it is does NOT mean you know what it is.  UFO does not mean alien by default.  To quote/paraphrase Carl Sagan: "Extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence".  In the mean time, we have to accept that we cannot always explain every strange looking thing we see.  It doesn't mean it's aliens.
